content.text:
I'll help you warm up by exploring the codebase. Let me start by understanding the project structure and then look at the recent changes.

## Project Structure

Let me get an overview of the project structure:

<Bash>
find /Users/juliani/repos/svelte5/wiki -type f -name "*.svelte" -o -name "*.ts" -o -name "*.js" -o -name "*.md" | head -20
</Bash>

## Recent Changes

I see from the git status that `docs/notes.md` has been modified. Let me check what changed:

<Read>
/Users/juliani/repos/svelte5/wiki/docs/notes.md
</Read>

## File Search

Let me search for Svelte component files to understand the codebase structure:

<Glob>
**/*.svelte
</Glob>

Let me also look for TypeScript/JavaScript files:

<Glob>
**/*.ts
</Glob>

<Glob>
**/*.js
</Glob>

## Code Content Search

Let me search for files containing "bubble" or "menu" based on the recent commit messages:

<Grep>
bubble|menu
</Grep>

This gives me a good overview of the project. It appears to be a Svelte 5 wiki application with recent work on bubble menus, inline menus, and block actions. The codebase contains Svelte components, TypeScript files, and documentation.

Would you like me to dive deeper into any specific area of the codebase?
